title: Welcoming Caroline: Veolia Deploys Electric Telehandler at Integrated Waste Management Facility – FM Industry - FM Industry
summary: Veolia, a waste management company, has introduced an electric telehandler at its Southwark facility. This electric telehandler, named 'Caroline', is expected to reduce CO2 emissions by 65% compared to diesel models. The company believes this new equipment will contribute to its sustainability goals and reduce its carbon footprint.

title: Explore the 10 Leading Circular Economy Examples in 2024 - StartUs Insights
summary: The circular economy is a model for sustainable development that focuses on reducing waste and extending product lifecycles. The article explores how this approach is being implemented across various industries, from chemicals and materials to agriculture and electronics, by companies like ReSolved Technologies, Circular Food, and Treetop Biopak. These companies are creating new products and processes that reduce waste, conserve resources, and promote sustainability.

title: Towards a Circular Plastics Economy: India's Actions to #BeatPlasticPollution - TERI
summary: India is facing a plastic waste crisis, generating 34.7 lakh tonnes of plastic waste annually. The article discusses various national and international efforts to address this issue, including bans on single-use plastics, extended producer responsibility (EPR) regulations, and initiatives to promote a circular economy for plastics. It also highlights the crucial role of the informal recycling sector and emphasizes the need for increased collaboration between governments, businesses, and individuals to effectively manage plastic waste.

title: Coastal Park Material Recovery Facility construction project on track - Democratic Alliance
summary: The City of Cape Town is constructing a new Material Recovery Facility (MRF) to increase recycling capacity. The MRF will process 65 tons of recyclable materials per day, creating jobs and reducing the amount of waste going to landfills. The project is a significant step towards a more sustainable waste management system in Cape Town.

title: Construction of new recycling facility in Cape Town on track for completion next year - Creamer Media's Engineering News
summary: Cape Town is building a new material recovery facility (MRF) at the Coastal Park landfill site to process recyclables. The R186-million facility is expected to sort 65 tons of recycled material daily, creating 100 jobs and allowing the city to expand its recycling collection program. The MRF will include mechanical separation equipment, offices, a training center, and a drop-off facility for various waste types.
